# OldSTL Project - GitHub Copilot Instructions

This file provides workspace-specific custom instructions to GitHub Copilot.

## Project Overview

- **Project Type**: Historical Map Web Application
- **Primary Language**: JavaScript (Vanilla), HTML5, CSS3
- **Framework**: Leaflet.js v1.9.4 for interactive maps
- **Data Format**: JSON-based location data (OldSF-style structure)

## Project Structure

- `index.html` - Main application entry point
- `src/js/app.js` - Core map logic and event handlers
- `src/css/styles.css` - All styling and animations
- `src/data/locations.json` - Historical photo metadata
- `src/data/templates/record.json` - Data structure template

## Key Features

- Interactive Leaflet map with custom markers
- Time-based filtering with dual-range slider
- Side panel for photo browsing
- Modal viewer for full-size images
- Active marker highlighting with count display
- Smart map panning to keep markers visible

## Code Conventions

- Use ES6+ features (async/await, arrow functions, const/let)
- Vanilla JavaScript - no frameworks beyond Leaflet
- Data helper functions: `getYear()`, `getLatLng()`, `getThumbnail()`, etc.
- CSS custom properties for dynamic styling
- Semantic HTML5 markup

## Data Structure

Photos follow OldSF-style format with:
- `extracted.latlon` - [lat, lng] array
- `extracted.date_range` - ["YYYY-MM-DD", "YYYY-MM-DD"] array
- `url` - Main image URL (thumbnails generated by replacing width parameter)
- `note`, `description`, `folder`, `date` fields

## Development Notes

- No build process - static site served directly
- OpenStreetMap tiles for base map
- Local development with Live Server
- Ready for GitHub Pages deployment
